findings.title: Integer under/overflow vulnerability
findings.description: Arithmetic operation can cause integer underflow or overflow.

findings.title: Floating Point and Rounding Accuracy
findings.description: Potential loss of precision due to floating point and rounding inaccuracies.

findings.title: Manager functions for emergency handle
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Crucial function and data access
findings.description: Access control issues related to crucial functions and data access

findings.title: Count of calling important task, contract state change, intentional task delay
findings.description: The finding suggests that there is a vulnerability related to the count of calling important tasks, changing contract states, and intentionally delaying tasks.

findings.title: N/A
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Gas limit excess due to unpredictable implementation
findings.description: Unpredictable implementation can cause gas limit excess leading to denial of service.

findings.title: Dependency on the block number or timestamp
findings.description: The contract relies on the block number or timestamp, which can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Frontrunning
findings.description: Miner manipulation vulnerability where a miner can reorder transactions to their advantage.

findings.title: Proper use of Check-Effect-Interact pattern
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Prevention of state change after external call
findings.description: The contract uses delegateCall function which allows the called contract to modify the state of the current contract, posing a risk of unintended state changes.

findings.title: Error handling and logging
findings.description: Inadequate error handling and logging mechanisms can lead to unidentified errors and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Code injection using delegatecall
findings.description: The contract allows code injection through the use of delegatecall, enabling an attacker to execute arbitrary code on behalf of the current contract.

findings.title: Inappropriate use of assembly code
findings.description: The contract uses assembly code in an inappropriate manner.

findings.title: Deviate from standards that can be an obstacle of interoperability
findings.description: Not complying with standards can hinder interoperability.

findings.title: Wrong condition checking logic in checkUserOpOffset
findings.description: The function checkUserOpOffset has a wrong condition checking logic where it sets success return value to 1 even if the userOp passes only the first condition, ignoring the second and third conditions.

findings.title: Unintended execution leads to error
findings.description: Logic Error/Bug: Unintended execution leads to error.

findings.title: Coherency between the documented spec and implementation
findings.description: Inconsistency between the documentation and the actual implementation of the smart contract.

findings.title: Variable and function visibility setting
findings.description: Insecure variable and function visibility settings can lead to unauthorized access or manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: Contract interface is properly implemented on code
findings.description: The contract implements a subset of required functions for an account in a modular and reusable manner.

findings.title: Signature Replay Attack can be done on MinimalAccount
findings.description: The nonce will not be increased when the callData exists but not initCode, allowing an attacker to replay the UserOperation.
